alert.note: Alert for Bee; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nueces, western San Patricio, northeastern Jim Wells, southwestern Refugio, southeastern Live Oak and southeastern Bee Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1144 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Sinton, or 9 miles east of Mathis, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beeville, Sinton, Mathis, Skidmore, Odem, St. Paul, Lake City, San Patricio, Edroy, Tynan, West Sinton, Argenta, Papalote, Mount Lucas, Dinero, Lakeside and Lake Corpus Christi. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 17 and 49. US Highway 181 between mile markers 594 and 628. US Highway 77 between mile markers 638 and 658. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; Live Oak
